isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - REASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If previously removed, install the corresponding snap rings in the I.D. of the mainshaft gears.
Secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks, pilot end of the shaft down ( Figure 206). If previously removed, install the roll pin in the keyway.

figure.caption: Figure 206. Secure Mainshaft in Vise

step1.para: Install the 3rd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of washer up. Rotate washer in the 1st or bottom groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft ( Figure 207). Install the key in the mainshaft keyway to lock washer in place.

figure.caption: Figure 207. Install and Rotate 3rd Speed Gear Limit Washer to Align Splines With Mainshaft Splines

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 208).

figure.caption: Figure 208. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the 3rd speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 209).

figure.caption: Figure 209. Install 3rd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

note.para: Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with clutching teeth in gear hubs. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each gear in the mainshaft assembly.

para.title: Setting Correct Axial Clearances for Mainshaft Gears

svcproc.para: Axial Clearance (End-Play) Limits Are: .005" - .012" for all mainshaft gears
Washers are used to obtain the correct limits; six thicknesses are available as follows:

note.para: New style limit washers come in a full range of tolerances as corresponding colors listed above "+ red." (Example: "Orange plus red" limit washer has an inch limit thickness of .258-.260.)

svcproc.para: Always use the .248-.250 tolerance washer (White or White plus red) in the reverse, LO and 2nd speed gear positions as shown in Figure 210.

figure.caption: Figure 210. Always Use .248-.250 Tolerance Washer in Reverse, LO and 2nd Speed Gear Positions

step1.para: Install the 2nd speed gear on the shaft against the 3rd speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 211).

figure.caption: Figure 211. Install 2nd Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Install the spacer in 2nd speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 212).

figure.caption: Figure 212. Install Spacer in 2nd Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 2nd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer down and against the spacer ( Figure 213). Rotate the washer in the 2nd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and reinsert key in the keyway to lock the washer in place ( inset, Figure 213).

figure.caption: Figure 213. Install and Rotate 2nd Speed Gear Limit Washer to Align Splines With Mainshaft Splines

step1.para: Insert two large screwdrivers between the 2nd and 3rd speed gears to check axial clearances ( Figure 214). Apply slight downward pressure on screwdriver handles to spread gears evenly. Making sure the gear hubs are parallel, insert a feeler gauge between the hubs. Correct axial clearance should be from .005" to .012" . If the clearance is less than the minimum .005" tolerance, the limit washer in the 2nd speed gear should be replaced by a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the clearance checked is greater than the maximum .012" tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed in the 2nd speed gear. This would decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 214. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the 1st-2nd speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 215).

figure.caption: Figure 215. Install 1st-2nd Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 1st speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate washer in the 2nd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and reinsert key in the keyway to lock the washer in place ( Figure 216).

figure.caption: Figure 216. Install and Rotate 1st Speed Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Install the spacer and 1st speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with internal splines of the spacer ( Figure 217).

figure.caption: Figure 217. Install Spacer and 1st Speed Gear

step1.para: Install the LO speed gear on the shaft against 1st speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 218).

figure.caption: Figure 218. Install LO Speed Gear

step1.para: Install the spacer in LO speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 219).

figure.caption: Figure 219. Install Spacer in LO Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the LO speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer down and against the spacer. Rotate the washer in the 4th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert the key in the keyway to lock washer in place ( Figure 220).

figure.caption: Figure 220. Install and Rotate LO Speed Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Check axial clearances and make adjustments, if necessary, between the LO and 1st speed gears as described in step 9 of this section ( Figure 221).

figure.caption: Figure 221. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the LO-Reverse speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 222).

figure.caption: Figure 222. Install LO-Reverse Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the reverse gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate the washer in the 5th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and reinsert key in keyway to lock the washer in place ( Figure 223).

figure.caption: Figure 223. Install and Rotate Reverse Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 224).

figure.caption: Figure 224. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install reverse gear on the mainshaft ( Figure 225). Engage the clutching teeth of the gear with the splines of the spacer and sliding clutch and move the reverse gear against the LO speed gear.

figure.caption: Figure 225. Install Reverse Gear on Mainshaft

note.para: Do not replace the reverse gear internal snap ring at this step.

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft assembly from the vise. Align the missing internal spline of 3rd-4th speed sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft and install on the front of the shaft, engaging the external splines of the sliding clutch with the clutching teeth of 3rd speed gear ( Figure 226).

figure.caption: Figure 226. Install 3rd-4th Speed Sliding Clutch
